discounted by a haircut (the collateral factor).","params":{"assetAddresses":"Array of the contract addresses of the assets.","assetAmounts":"Array with the amounts of the assets.","assetIds":"Array This function does not check if the sequencer is down or is back up less than the grace period.","params":{"assetAmounts":"Array with the amounts of the assets.","assetIds":"Array of the ids of the assets.","assets":"Array of the contract addresses of the assets.","creditor":"The contract address of the Creditor."},"returns":{"valuesAndRiskFactors":"The values of the assets, denominated in USD with 18 Decimals precision and the corresponding risk factors for each asset for the given Creditor."}},"getValuesInUsdRecursive(address,address[],uint256[],uint256[])":{"details":"The function getValuesInUsdRecursive should only be called by Derived Asset Modules for recursive pricing of assets and should NOT be used by external contracts. attacks.","params":{"assetAmounts":"Array with the amounts of the assets.","assetIds":"Array of the ids of the assets.","assets":"Array of the contract addresses of the assets.","creditor":"The Creditor."},"setSequencerUptimeOracle(address)":{"notice":"Sets a new sequencer uptime oracle in the case the current oracle is reverting."},"unpause()":{"notice":"This function is used to unpause flags that could be abused to lock user assets."},"unpause(bool,bool)":{"notice":"This function is used to unpause one or more flags."}},"notice":"The Registry has a number of responsibilities, all related to the management of Assets and Oracles:  - It stores the mapping between assets and their respective Asset Modules.  - It stores the mapping between oracles and their respective Oracle Modules.  - It orchestrates the pricing of a basket of assets in a single unit of account.  - It orchestrates deposits and withdrawals of an Account per Creditor.  - It manages the risk parameters of all assets per Creditor.","version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"src/Registry.sol":"Registry"},"evmVersion":"shanghai","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[":@openzeppelin/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/",":@uniswap/v3-core/contracts/=lib/v3-core/contracts/",":ds-test/=lib/forge-std/lib/ds-test/src/",":forge-std/=lib/forge-std/src/",":openzeppelin-contracts/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/",":solmate/=lib/solmate/src/",":v3-core/=lib/v3-core/",":v3-periphery/=lib/v3-periphery/contracts/"]},"sources":{"lib/solmate/src/auth/Owned.sol":{"keccak256":"0xfedb27d14c508342c33eb067c9a02eabcdb0f9dcf93b04ded1001f580d12d0ea","license":"AGPL-3.0-only","urls":["bzz-raw://1ff52bbee698b9cf9e4574615e6550be0887ccf355f6571e23d6f25b332e79b4","dweb:/ipfs/QmVorA2apojVRStzS7h8aFccR3Uv32G6HVtBtFHZrE7YXx"]},"lib/solmate/src/utils/FixedPointMathLib.sol":{"keccak256":"0x1b62af9baf5b8e991ed7531bc87f45550ba9d61e8dbff5caf237ccaf3a3fd843","license":"AGPL-3.0-only","urls":["bzz-raw://b7b38b977c5305b18ceefbeed4c9ceaaaefa419b520de62de6604ea661f8c0a9","dweb:/ipfs/QmecMRzgfMyDVa2pvBqMMDLYBappaj7Aa3qcMoQYEQrhWi"]},"src/Registry.sol":{"keccak256":"0x388e8cf1ec7573f84f38b598be5e5a12adf69c2a7908bf8d972d07e0c8c62e88","license":"BUSL-1.1","urls":["bzz-raw://6c112190c1b74dec2b467434732fd7af696130f3dfd134dcdf82ad2ba4dab32b","dweb:/ipfs/QmTDHyoXKVmvhSZu9vZVDk8sYP2A3JPUgWcgWST8wFMCSZ"]},"src/guardians/BaseGuardian.sol":{"keccak256":"0x19816f0cd2c699702a0d9a5cc33d13d0f3cf26d8b299eb0920516e68d82807bc","license":"BUSL-1.1","urls":["bzz-raw://bfd4a817abc3417dfa62d5f58db53400050bca2ce0a48322937fb6c0b0901f91","dweb:/ipfs/QmPYoDqHkSVNFuGEZDs1pYRC36xh5qEMAu2f4Xi8w7WknW"]},"src/guardians/RegistryGuardian.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf4542e644e67ea534aecfdfbd1ac628ae98851941bf56479745c89dfaf8d6d49","license":"BUSL-1.1","urls":["bzz-raw://1d882f9dfa5ce55fb18081aad04da2900922d74c320c022050db1a9e56b1201c","dweb:/ipfs/QmPY4QiektGHdK2u1EsFYHmKYj22uBEj8f3ZwnC6u4DyTc"]},"s e9863fd8c5ce71940d2079356290e746f11f067c0bcc1f107e4489","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://3375b73d3845eb9b3edc32dff320528b6381c9c8f7ce53bde7cf9bae9a763157","dweb:/ipfs/QmcH1yf4xLZNsR5NQfXq5dwpnpXVJNj5bi8ttoUbnPsXXJ"]},"src/libraries/AssetValuationLib.sol":{"keccak256":"0x3a422c02f50b1c8cd9a6f193b607dddb2acbb28b6a03a3774fc7a76b753346c8","license":"BUSL-1.1","urls":["bzz-raw://5901738c5fe4963e253ec59b181ff16bda4e44305eeebf1aeace83f5fd820358","dweb:/ipfs/QmNy5Ep7qAgKL1gXVWra1xHUWQWeb9VKJjmCnFhaLdLfrA"]},"src/libraries/BitPackingLib.sol":{"keccak256":"0x248b72b6ad2d6b2c1d48af3576674e43fd778201aaee589e3971330fbf0aa586","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://dcb47597e6d47645de38128011f7a5cf6ac52a1762ac8bd6cfd90e14076d0097","dweb:/ipfs/QmVYuSVExjMXnLhWMQgZtB7u7ptCtiuv3UCqDSk6BhHYBe"]},"src/libraries/Errors.sol":{"keccak256":"0x28d48f9d2d5f968933aa37cde654b6aa0a7dacf6fb6c3ace4bfa283a63304595","license":"BUSL-1.1","urls":["bzz-raw://c47b87e87c7d077d8817a5b9e0733e94bac059a92e7b42ffe8c4f0058eb23ef8","dweb:/ipfs/Qmev4Gjrb1nghRUgCbjVpqWCiuMZw5rxFnfei8YTtx3BDK"]}},"version":1}

addAsset(uint96,address).details: Assets that are already in the registry cannot be overwritten, as that would make it possible for devs to change the asset pricing.

params.assetAddress: The contract address of the asset.
params.assetType: Identifier for the type of the asset.

params.assetModule: The contract address of the Asset Module.

params.oracleModule: The contract address of the Oracle Module.

params.assetAddresses: Array of the contract addresses of the assets.

returns.assetTypes: Array with the types of the assets. 0 = Unknown asset. 1 = ERC20. 2 = ERC721. 3 = ERC1155. ...

batchProcessDeposit(address,address[],ui.details: If no Creditor is set, only check that the assets are allowed (= can be priced).If a Creditor is set, processDirectDeposit in the Asset Module checks and updates the exposure for each asset and if applicable, its underlying asset(s).

params.amounts: Array with the amounts of the assets.
params.assetAddresses: Array of the contract addresses of the assets.
params.assetIds: Array of the ids of the assets.
params.creditor: The contract address of the Creditor.

batchProcessWithdrawal(address,address[].details: If a Creditor is set, processDirectWithdrawal in the Asset Module updates the exposure for each asset and underlying asset.

params.amounts: Array with the amounts of the assets.
params.assetAddresses: Array of the contract addresses of the assets.
params.assetIds: Array of the ids of the assets.
params.creditor: The contract address of the Creditor.

returns.assetTypes: Array with the types of the assets. 0 = Unknown asset. 1 = ERC20. 2 = ERC721. 3 = ERC1155. ...

params.guardian_: The address of the new guardian.

checkOracleSequence(bytes32).details: The following checks are performed: - The oracle must be previously added to the Registry and must still be active. - The last Asset of oracles (except for the last oracle) must be equal to the first asset of the next oracle. - The last Asset of the last oracle must be USD.

params.oracleSequence: The sequence of the oracles to price a certain asset in USD, packed in a single bytes32 object.

returns._0: A boolean, indicating if the sequence complies with the set of criteria.

params.factory: The contract address of the Arcadia Accounts Factory.
params.sequencerUptimeOracle_: The contract address of the sequencer uptime oracle.

getCollateralValue(address,address,addre.details: No need to check equality of length of arrays, since they are generated by the Account.No need to check the Numeraire, since getValue()-call will revert for unknown assets.Only fungible tokens can be used as Numeraire.The collateral value is equal to the spot value of the assets, discounted by a haircut (the collateral factor).

params.assetAddresses: Array of the contract addresses of the assets.
params.assetAmounts: Array with the amounts of the assets.
params.assetIds: Array of the ids of the assets.
params.creditor: The contract address of the Creditor.
params.numeraire: The contract address of the Numeraire.

returns.collateralValue: The collateral value of the assets, denominated in the Numeraire.

getLiquidationValue(address,address,addr.details: No need to check equality of length of arrays, since they are generated by the Account.No need to check the Numeraire, since getValue()-call will revert for unknown assets.Only fungible tokens can be used as Numeraire.The liquidation value is equal to the spot value of the assets, discounted by a haircut (the liquidation factor).

params.assetAddresses: Array of the contract addresses of the assets.
params.assetAmounts: Array with the amounts of the assets.
params.assetIds: Array of the ids of the assets.
params.creditor: The contract address of the Creditor.
params.numeraire: The contract address of the Numeraire.

returns.liquidationValue: The liquidation value of the assets, denominated in the Numeraire.

getRateInUsd(bytes32).details: The oracle rate expresses how much USD (18 decimals precision) is required to buy 1 token of the asset.

params.oracleSequence: The sequence of the oracles to price the asset in USD, packed in a single bytes32 object.

returns.rate: The USD rate of an asset, 18 decimals precision.

params.assetAddresses: Array of the contract addresses of the assets.
params.assetIds: Array of the ids of the assets.
params.creditor: The contract address of the Creditor.

returns.collateralFactors: Array of the collateral factors of the assets for the Creditor, 4 decimals precision.
returns.liquidationFactors: Array of the liquidation factors of the assets for the Creditor, 4 decimals precision.

getTotalValue(address,address,address[],.details: No need to check equality of length of arrays, since they are generated by the Account.No need to check the Numeraire, since getValue()-call will revert for unknown assets.Only fungible tokens can be used as Numeraire.

params.assetAddresses: Array of the contract addresses of the assets.
params.assetAmounts: Array with the amounts of the assets.
params.assetIds: Array of the ids of the assets.
params.creditor: The contract address of the Creditor.
params.numeraire: The contract address of the Numeraire.

returns.assetValue: The combined value of the assets, denominated in the Numeraire.

params.creditor: The contract address of the Creditor.
params.deltaExposureAssetToUnderlyingAsset: The increase or decrease in exposure of the asset to the underlying asset since the last interaction.
params.exposureAssetToUnderlyingAsset: The amount of exposure of the asset to the underlying asset.

returns.recursiveCalls: The number of calls done to different asset modules to process the deposit/withdrawal of the asset.
returns.usdExposureAssetToUnderlyingAsset: The USD-value of the exposure of the asset to its underlying asset, 18 decimals precision.

params.creditor: The contract address of the Creditor.
params.deltaExposureAssetToUnderlyingAsset: The increase or decrease in exposure of the asset to the underlying asset since the last interaction.
params.exposureAssetToUnderlyingAsset: The amount of exposure of the asset to the underlying asset.

returns.usdExposureAssetToUnderlyingAsset: The Usd value of the exposure of the asset to its underlying asset, 18 decimals precision.

getValuesInNumeraire(address,address,add.details: No need to check equality of length of arrays, since they are generated by the Account.No need to check the Numeraire, since getValue()-call will revert for unknown assets.Only fungible tokens can be used as Numeraire.

params.assetAddresses: Array of the contract addresses of the assets.
params.assetAmounts: Array with the amounts of the assets.
params.assetIds: Array of the ids of the assets.
params.creditor: The contract address of the Creditor.
params.numeraire: The contract address of the Numeraire.

returns.valuesAndRiskFactors: The array of values per assets, denominated in the Numeraire.

getValuesInUsd(address,address[],uint256.details: getValuesInUsd is a function for internal calculations and should NOT be used by external contracts. The function has a visibility public since it is also called by Derived Asset Modules for recursive pricing of assets. This function does not check if the sequencer is down or is back up less than the grace period.

params.assetAmounts: Array with the amounts of the assets.
params.assetIds: Array of the ids of the assets.
params.assets: Array of the contract addresses of the assets.
params.creditor: The contract address of the Creditor.

returns.valuesAndRiskFactors: The values of the assets, denominated in USD with 18 Decimals precision and the corresponding risk factors for each asset for the given Creditor.

getValuesInUsdRecursive(address,address[.details: The function getValuesInUsdRecursive should only be called by Derived Asset Modules for recursive pricing of assets and should NOT be used by external contracts. This function does not do sanity checks such as:  - Check if the sequencer is down or is back up less than the grace period.  - Check if the value of the asset exceeds a minimal value to prevent dust attacks.

params.assetAmounts: Array with the amounts of the assets.
params.assetIds: Array of the ids of the assets.
params.assets: Array of the contract addresses of the assets.
params.creditor: The contract address of the Creditor.

returns.valuesAndRiskFactors: The values of the assets, denominated in USD with 18 Decimals precision and the corresponding risk factors for each asset for the given Creditor.

params.asset: The contract address of the asset.

returns._0: A boolean, indicating if the asset is allowed.

pause().details: This function will pause the functionality to: - Withdraw assets. - Deposit assets.

setRiskParameters(address,uint128,uint64.details: A minimum USD-value will help to avoid remaining dust amounts in Accounts, which couldn't be liquidated.

params.creditor: The contract address of the Creditor.
params.gracePeriod: The grace period after the sequencer is back up, during which no transactions relying on pricing logic can be executed (increasing open positions, withdrawing collateral and liquidations).
params.maxRecursiveCalls: The maximum number of calls to different asset modules that are required to process the deposit/withdrawal/pricing of a single asset.
params.minUsdValue: The minimum USD-value of assets that are taken into account for the Creditor, denominated in USD with 18 decimals precision.

params.assetModule: The contract address of the Derived Asset Module.
params.creditor: The contract address of the Creditor.
params.maxUsdExposureProtocol: The maximum USD exposure of the protocol for each Creditor, denominated in USD with 18 decimals precision.
params.riskFactor: The risk factor of the asset for the Creditor, 4 decimals precision.

setRiskParametersOfPrimaryAsset(address,.details: Any Creditor can set risk parameters for any asset, does not have any influence on risk parameters set by other Creditors.

params.asset: The contract address of the asset.
params.collateralFactor: The collateral factor of the asset for the Creditor, 4 decimals precision.
params.creditor: The contract address of the Creditor.
params.liquidationFactor: The liquidation factor of the asset for the Creditor, 4 decimals precision.
params.maxExposure: The maximum exposure of a Creditor to the asset.

params.sequencerUptimeOracle_: The contract address of the new sequencer uptime oracle.

unpause().details: This function will unpause the functionality to: - Withdraw assets.

unpause(bool,bool).details: This function can unPause withdraw and deposit individually.Can only update flags from paused (true) to unpaused (false), cannot be used the other way around (to set unpaused flags to paused).

params.depositPaused_: It is false when deposit functionality should be unPaused.
params.withdrawPaused_: It is false when withdraw functionality should be unPaused.

addAsset(uint96,address).notice: Adds a new asset to the Registry.

addAssetModule(address).notice: Adds a new Asset Module to the Registry.

addOracle().notice: Adds a new oracle to the Registry.

addOracleModule(address).notice: Adds a new Oracle Module to the Registry.

changeGuardian(address).notice: This function is used to set the guardian address

checkOracleSequence(bytes32).notice: Verifies whether a sequence of oracles complies with a predetermined set of criteria.

getCollateralValue(address,address,addre.notice: Calculates the collateral value of a combination of assets, denominated in a given Numeraire.

getLiquidationValue(address,address,addr.notice: Calculates the getLiquidationValue of a combination of assets, denominated in a given Numeraire.

getRateInUsd(bytes32).notice: Returns the rate of a certain primary asset in USD.

getRiskFactors(address,address[],uint256.notice: Returns the risk factors per asset for a given Creditor.

getTotalValue(address,address,address[],.notice: Calculates the combined value of a combination of assets, denominated in a given Numeraire.

getUsdValueExposureToUnderlyingAssetAfte.notice: This function is called by Asset Modules of non-primary assets in order to update the exposure of an underlying asset after a deposit.
This function is called by Asset Modules of non-primary assets in order to update the exposure of an underlying asset after a withdrawal.

getValuesInNumeraire(address,address,add.notice: Calculates the values per asset, denominated in a given Numeraire.

getValuesInUsdRecursive(address,address[.notice: Calculates the USD values of underlying assets.

inRegistry(address).notice: Checks if an asset is in the Registry.

isAllowed(address,uint256).notice: Checks if an asset is allowed.

pause().notice: This function is used to pause all the flags of the contract.

setRiskParameters(address,uint128,uint64.notice: Sets the risk parameters for a given Creditor.

setRiskParametersOfDerivedAM(address,add.notice: Sets the risk parameters for the protocol of the Derived Asset Module for a given Creditor.

setRiskParametersOfPrimaryAsset(address,.notice: Sets the risk parameters for a Primary Asset for a given Creditor.

setSequencerUptimeOracle(address).notice: Sets a new sequencer uptime oracle in the case the current oracle is reverting.

unpause().notice: This function is used to unpause flags that could be abused to lock user assets.

unpause(bool,bool).notice: This function is used to unpause one or more flags.
